learningContent.title: Adding basic elements to a concept topic

lcInstruction.p:
Some of the most commonly-used elements in a concept topic include

(paragraph),

    (unordered list),
      (ordered list), and (note or admonition). These elements were covered in the Introduction to DITA course. This lesson gives a brief review of these elements and shows how to add them to a concept topic.

The <conbody> element has an open content model. This means that the elements contained in <conbody> are not required to follow a strict sequence. As long as an element is allowed inside <conbody>, it can appear in any order. The exceptions are the <section> and <example> elements, which can only be followed by other <section> or <example> elements.

step.info: The <ul> element is used for unordered or bulleted lists.

The <ul> element contains the <li> or list item element. Each <li> element contains the text for a bulleted entry in the list. I would be more specific here: <ul> must contain at least one <li> element (and it can only contain <li> elements).

Wild duck species

North American wild ducks belong to one of the following categories:

  • Dabbling ducks

  • Diving ducks

  • Sea ducks

The longest species of dabbling ducks in North America are:

  1. Northern pintail

  2. Mallard

  3. American black duck

Although the northern pintail is the longest dabbling duck, the mallard is generally considered the largest because of its heavier body weight.
